results.title: Modern Britain visits Australia
results.brief_description: Some of the 25 million pounds worth of goods put on display at the 1964 British Exhibition by the principal British companies associated with Australian companies in domestic and foreign trade. Includes the British Military Tournament held at the Sydney Showground.

results.title: Mission: Australia (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: Garner MacLennan Interactive and Mission Australia Consortium
results.brief_description: What kind of place will Australia be in the future? Join Aunty M the River Red Gum and a whole host of fascinating characters on an interactive mission to maintain some of Australia’s uniquely beautiful environments and preserve its distinctive flora and fauna. Enter the simulator and journey to the coast, an estuary, an arid rangeland, or even the city where you will encounter environmental problems, and be offered a wide range of suggestions to solve them, but keep in mind every action wins a score. Some solutions might not rate in terms of human prosperity, but will drastically improve the environment. Alternatively, some solutions will benefit humans, but impact negatively on our surroundings. Your mission is to find a logical balance between profit and preservation before it’s too late. Beautiful graphics, easy to install and very user-friendly. Teacher’s notes and class activity sheets can be downloaded from the CD. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: For Windows, 486 DX2/66 or better (Pentium recommended) running Windows 95/Windows 3.1, 16 megabytes or more of RAM. Double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended). Sound card (stereo 16-bit recommened), and 640X480 Super VGA display (256 colour or better). For Macintosh, 68040 or better (Power PC recommended) running Mac OS System 7.5 or later, 8 megabytes of free RAM. Double-speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), 640X480 display (256 colour or better).

results.title: Miss Australia 1959
results.brief_description: A segment from the 1959 Miss Australia Quest held in Brisbane’s Festival Hall during Queensland’s centenary celebrations. Miss Jean Stanbury of Western Australia is announced as the winner. Miss Australia 1958 is present as one of the judges.

results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 091 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Dr Lubke, Federal President, visits Vienna; preparing for summer tourists in Berlin; the Humboldt museum; art prizes for 1962; a children’s music competition in Stuttgart; violin-making in Mittenwald; a satellite tracking station; gymnastic and athletic contests; soccer match between Uruguay and West Germany.

results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 090 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Floods in northern Germany as the dikes break for the first time in 137 years; President de Gaulle talks with Dr. Adenauer; Robert Kennedy visits Berlin; industries and a young theatre in Berlin; a civic centre in Hannover; gokart racing; international equestrian high jump in Dortmund; a slalom race at the end of skiing season.

results.title: Miracle in Minnesota
results.creator_credit: Empire Photosound Inc and Minnesota Theatre Co Foundation
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the Tyrone Guthrie Theatre in Minneapolis, from construction to opening night. Shows the backstage functions of rehearsal, costume work and set building. Includes excepts from Hamlet, The Mixer, Three Sisters and Death of a Salesman.

results.title: Mint tea = Le The la menthe
results.brief_description: A young man sits on the terrace of a Montparnasse cafe, watching the other patrons as they meet friends, enjoy a drink, flirt, or sit waiting. His own loneliness becomes increasingly apparent against this background of other people, with whom he cannot communicate. French language with some English.

results.title: Minkey
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodall and Western Australia Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: A promotional video for the sport of “Minkey”, a modified form of hockey and part of the Aussie Sports program. Minkey can be played by combined teams of boys and girls on any flat surface and involves a number of individual and team skills.

results.title: Mini movie makers
results.brief_description: Children at the Henry Street Settlement in New York exhibit the efforts of their film club. Two processes were employed: making a film with and without a camera. Firstly, they drew directly on clear film with magic markers, then used paper cutout puppets. Voice-over comments by the children describe their techniques.
